summary: Email correspondence between Florence Hutner, General Counsel for the NYC Office of Chief Medical Examiner (OCME), and an unnamed federal investigator regarding redactions and withholding of materials from Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy file, including scene photos and a 360 scan. The investigator confirms the request to withhold materials is temporary for the ongoing investigation.

persons.name: Florence Hutner
persons.role: General Counsel, Office of Chief Medical Examiner (NYC)
persons.context: Corresponds with a federal investigator regarding redactions and withholding of materials from Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy file, including scene photos and a 360 scan.

events.title: Initial Redaction Request
events.description: An unnamed federal investigator sends an initial request to Florence Hutner regarding redactions for the 'Epstein File'.

events.title: Follow-up on Redaction Request
events.description: Email exchange clarifies the scope and duration of the request to withhold autopsy materials (scene photos, 360 scan) related to Jeffrey Epstein's death.

locations: Office of Chief Medical Examiner, 421 E. 26th Street, New York, NY 10016
keyFacts: The NYC Office of the Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) was in communication with federal investigators regarding the autopsy file of Jeffrey Epstein.
Federal investigators requested the withholding of specific materials from Epstein's file, including scene photographs and a 360-degree scan.
The request to withhold materials was stated to be temporary, lasting only for the duration of the federal investigation, not permanent.
The OCME noted it would comply with any court order for the unredacted file but would notify investigators so they could seek to preserve investigative confidentiality.
A voicemail from the MCC (Metropolitan Correctional Center) was mentioned as being forwarded to the investigators, indicating communication regarding Epstein's incarceration and death.
